info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 8:21PM CDT until April 27 at 5:48AM CDT by NWS Jackson MS
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana...Mississippi...Arkansas...
Mississippi River Near Greenville affecting Washington, East Carroll, Issaquena and Chicot Counties.
Big Black River At West affecting Attala and Holmes Counties.
Yalobusha At Whaley affecting Carroll and Leflore Counties.
Big Sunflower River At Sunflower affecting Sunflower County.
Boeuf River Near Fort Necessity affecting Franklin Parish.
Mississippi River Near Arkansas City affecting Washington, Bolivar, Desha and Chicot Counties.
Mississippi River At Natchez affecting Concordia, Adams and Wilkinson Counties.
Mississippi River At Vicksburg affecting Tensas, Madison, Jefferson, Claiborne and Warren Counties.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississippi River at Natchez.
* WHEN...From Monday, April 14 to Sunday, April 27.
* IMPACTS...At 51 feet, Water is covering the roads in old downtown area of Fort Adams.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 33.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Monday, April 14 and to a crest of 52.0 feet Monday, April 21. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.water.noaa.gov/wfo/jan
The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 830 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY, APRIL 14 TO SUNDAY, APRIL 27

area.areaDesc: Concordia, LA; Adams, MS; Wilkinson, MS
